Events this weekend and beyond

5 fun things this week

LCJ 8:22 a.m. EDT October 29, 2014

Important schedule.(Photo: Getty Images/iStockphoto )

CONNECT 1 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

The Haunted Hotel. 3000 S. Fourth St., 8 p.m.-midnight Thursday; 8 p.m.-2 a.m. Friday; 8 p.m.-12:30 a.m. Saturday. Through Nov. 8. $20, $29 VIP fast pass. www.hauntedhotelky.com.

Nightmare Forest Haunted Park. Otter Creek Outdoor Recreation Area (formerly Otter Creek Park), near Muldraugh and Fort Knox, along Ky. 1638, near U.S. 31W., Brandenburg, dusk to 2 a.m. Friday and Saturday. Features Nightmare Forest trail; a second haunted trail, The Trail of Terror; Nightmare Forest Drive-In and Hawthorne's Circus Bizarre. Known for bringing movies to life, this year features "Halloween," "Friday the 13th," "Texas Chainsaw Massacre," "Hellraiser," "The Conjuring" and "The Purge." General admission, $19 advance, $20 at the door; speed pass, $26 advance, $30 at the door. www.yournightmarebegins.com.

F.A.T. Friday Trolley Hop. 6 p.m. Friday. Connects businesses in Clifton, Crescent Hill and Butchertown. Free trolleys run from Johnson Street in Butchertown to Frankfort and Stilz avenues with a stop at the Mellwood Arts & Entertainment Center. Transportation provided by TARC. www.fatfridayhop.org.

Bluegrass Center for Autism 4th Annual Evening of Puzzabilities — Toast of the Town. The Gillespie, 421 W. Market St., 6:30 p.m. Saturday. Features a mixology contest among bartenders from the city's favorite restaurants, cocktails, live and silent auctions and live music. Benefits Bluegrass Center for Autism and its students. $125. bca.ticketbud.com/2014-puzzabilities.

Civil War Living History: Commemorating the Construction of Union Fort Duffield. Fort Duffield, West Point, 10 a.m.-4 p.m. Sunday. Features union and confederate re-enactors, skirmish demonstrations (1 and 3 p.m.), encampments, memorial service (10 a.m., Founder's Cemetery), music by the Kentucky Home Guard Band, food and souvenirs. $5, $15 family (parents and children under age 18). fortduffield.com.

BARS & CLUBS: 5 spots for live music

BRING THE KIDS: 3 fun things for families

CONCERTS: Top shows to check out

ON STAGE: 5 productions now playing

And lots more stuff to do ...

Halloween

Jack O' Lantern Spectacular. Iroquois Park, behind Iroquois Amphitheater, dusk to 11 p.m. Thursday; dusk to midnight Friday and Saturday; dusk to 11 p.m. Sunday. Local artists will carve more than 5,000 pumpkins, which will light a trail the length of five football fields. Proceeds benefit Louisville Metro Parks Foundation. Tickets: Sunday-Thursday, $12, $10 seniors, $9 ages 3-12; Friday and Saturday, $15, $13 seniors, $12 for ages 3-12. www.jackolanternlouisville.com.

Danger Run. 7-11 p.m. Friday-Saturday. Starts at Lowe's at 501 Hurstbourne Parkway; 6651 Dixie Highway; or 1350 Veterans Parkway, Clarksville. Haunted house scavenger hunt, $10 free gas if you have four or more people in the car, free food from DQ Grill & Chill and vampire fangs. $20. www.dangerrun.com.

7th Street Haunt. 2900 7th Street Road, 8 p.m.-2 a.m. Friday and Saturday; 8-10:30 p.m. Sunday (Black Out Event, enter with only a flashlight). Over 13,000 square feet of horrific terror and a casket ride. $15 online; $18 at the door. www.7thstreethaunt.com.

Asylum Haunted Scream Park. 3101 Pond Station Road, 8 p.m.-2 a.m. Friday and Saturday. Four attractions, Darkness Falls on Asylum, Zombie City, Xterminate: Zalien Attack and Carnivale of Lost Souls. Recommended for ages 10 and older. $28. www.asylumhaunts.com.

The Devil's Attic. 647 W. Hill St., 8 p.m.-12:30 a.m. Friday and Saturday. Haunted house. Children under 12 must be accompanied by an adult. $18, $24 for speed pass. www.thedevilsattic.com.

Grim Trails. 12009 Rehl Road, dusk to 12:30 a.m. Friday and Saturday. Not recommended for children under the age of 10. $15, $10 for ages 10 and younger. www.grimtrails.com.

The World's Largest Halloween Party. Louisville Zoo, 1100 Trevilian Way, Thursday. Enter the zoo 5-8:30 p.m. The party provides not-so-scary fun for families and features costumed characters, storybook scenes throughout the zoo, trick-or-treating (for ages 11 and younger), Spooktacular Carousel ($2); The Halloween Express Train ($4); The Headless Horseman of Sleepy Hollow Tour ($2); Kaman's Handimals (starts at $10); Kaman's Face painting (starts at $8); Kaman's photo packages (starts at $15) and Louisville Youth Board Face Painting and Sand Art ($1-$4). Presented by Meijer's. Admission, $9 advance ticket (online); $10 day of event. (502) 459-2181. www.louisvillezoo.org.

Psychopathway. Hetzer Haunted House, 6615 North Drive, dusk-1 a.m. Friday. Scaring up some food for the needy. Admission is free, bring a non-perishable food item for Southwest Community Ministries.

Events

Kentucky Myasthenia Gravis Walk. Waterfront Park, Great Lawn, Sunday. Registration, 9 a.m.; walk 10 a.m. Participants collect donations. www.mgwalk.org/kentucky.

The Woman's Club of Louisville Christmas Extravaganza. 1320 S. Fourth St., 6-9 p.m. Nov. 5. Bourbon tasting hosted by Buffalo Trace Distillery, four-course dinner prepared by chef Harold Baker of Gary's on Spring and an auction. $100. (502) 634-9437.

Spectator sports

University of Louisville vs. Florida State. Papa John's Cardinal Stadium, 2800 S Floyd St., 7:30 p.m. Thursday. Football. $54. (800) 745-3000.

University of Louisville vs. Syracuse. KFC Yum! Center, 1 Arena Plaza, 7 p.m. Friday. Women's volleyball. $8. (800) 745-3000.

Churchill Downs. 700 Central Ave., 12:40 p.m. Thursday, Sunday and Nov. 5; 2 p.m. Friday; 2:15 p.m. Saturday. $3. (502) 636-4400.

Literary

Book signing. Carmichael's Bookstore, 2720 Frankfort Ave., 7 p.m. Friday. Steve Wiser will discuss and sign "Haunted Houses."

Tastings

Wine & Whiskey Night. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 6-8 p.m. Thursday. Wines that celebrate the spooky Halloween season. Devil's Cut Whiskey and other treats. Wines $3 by-the-glass and $2 whiskeys.

The Prisoner Release. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 5-8 p.m. Friday. Halloween is the release date of the cult classic "The Prisoner." The Prisoner will be $3 a glass, 10 percent off every bottle purchased and 15 percent off 12-bottle cases. (502) 708-1313.

Film

Planetarium shows. Gheens Science Hall & Rauch Planetarium, 108 W. Brandeis Ave. $8, $6 for ages 12 and younger, seniors and University of Louisville students. (502) 852-6664.

Friday: "Dynamic Earth," 8 p.m.; "Laser Fright Light," 9 p.m.; "Black Holes: The Other Side of Infinity," 10 p.m.; "Laser Pink Floyd: Dark Side of the Moon," 11 p.m.

Saturday:

"Perfect Little Planet," 1 p.m.; "Laser Fright Light," 2 p.m.; "Oasis in Space," 3 p.m.

Cruise

Belle of Louisville Dinner/Sightseeing Cruise. River Road, 7-9 p.m. Thursday and Friday. $43, $42 seniors, $27 children. Sightseeing only, $21, $20 seniors, $12 children. (502) 574-2992.

Belle of Louisville Lunch/Sightseeing Cruise. River Road, noon-2 p.m. Friday and Saturday. $35, $34 seniors, $25 children. Sightseeing only, $21, $20 seniors, $12 children. (502) 574-2992.

Spirit of Jefferson Harbor Cruise. River Road, 3-4 p.m. Saturday. $15, $9 children. (502) 574-2992.

Spirit of Jefferson Dinner/Sightseeing Cruise. River Road, 7-9 p.m. Saturday and Tuesday. $43, $42 seniors, $27 children. Sightseeing only, $21, $20 seniors, $12 children. (502) 574-2992.

Spirit of Jefferson Lunch/Sightseeing Cruise. Fourth and River Road, noon-2 p.m. July 16. $35, $34 seniors, $25 children. Sightseeing only, $21, $20 seniors, $12 children. (502) 574-2992.

Dances

Nuts N Honeys Dance Club. Dance Louisville, 8023 Catherine Lane, 7-11 p.m. Friday. Beginner and intermediate line dancing and couples dancing. $5. (502) 643-2786 or bigalofamerica@aol.com.

Singles Dance. Moose Lodge, 4615 Fegenbush Lane, 7:30-11 p.m. Sunday. Music by Kenny Sauter's Masters of Music DJ Service. Door prizes. $6, $2 off before 8 p.m. (502) 736-7600.

Exhibits

21c Museum Hotel. 700 W. Main St. "Transporting Transformation: Cuba, In and Out," by Jose Toirac, Sandra Ramos and others; "Chito Yoshida: Love for Sale," by Chito Yoshida; "A Thirsty Switch Still Quivers For Me," by Gina Phillips. "Burnouts," by Julia Christensen. All end April 2015. (502) 217-6300.

Actors Theatre Gallery. 316 W. Main St. "The Bard and The Binghams: Shakespeare at Actors Theatre." Ends Friday.

The Art Council Southern Indiana. Pat Harrison Gallery, 820 E. Market St., New Albany. "Harlan Hubbard: Plain Living, High Thinking - Part 1. "Personal Flotation Device: An Interactive Installation," by Susan Harrsion. Both end Saturday.

Asia Institute Crane House. 1244 S. Third St. "Poking the Lillies Pad," ceramic works by nationally recognized, emerging Asian American artists. Ends March 15.

B. Deemer Gallery. 2650 Frankfort Ave. "Alloquerer," paintings by Carolyn Young Hisel. Ends Nov. 12.

Bellarmine University McGrath Gallery. 2001 Newburg Road. "Train," by Caren Cunningham. Ends Saturday.

Carnegie Center for Art & History. 201 E. Spring St., New Albany. "Earth-Tones: Art Quilts," by Penny Sisto. Ends Jan. 10.

Conrad-Caldwell House Museum. 1402 St. James Court. "Louisville's River." Ends May 31, 2015.

Craft(s) Gallery. 572 S. Fourth St. "Have You Any Wool?" by Catherine Bryant and Vallorie Henderson. Ends Friday.

Flame Run Gallery. 815 W. Market St. Works by Steven Ciezki. Ends Nov. 22.

Frazier History Museum. 829 W. Main St. "Lifestyles of the Rich & Famous: Art, Fashion & Luxury During the Gilded Age." Ends Feb. 1.

Galerie Hertz. 1253 S. Preston. "Sycamore Shores/Modern Paintings & Drawings From the River," by Ray Kleinhelter. Ends Nov. 8.

Gallery 104. 104 E. Main St., La Grange. Works by Elizabeth Kirkwood. Ends Friday.

Garner Narrative Contemporary Fine Art. 642 E. Market St. "Deconstructing Melancholy," by Aleksandra Stone. Ends Nov. 28.

The Green Building. 732 E. Market St. "Incommunicado," a three-dimensional exhibit by Amy Chase, Patrick Donley and Brad White. Ends Nov. 28.

Horseshoe Gallery. Horseshoe Casino, 11999 Casino Center Drive, Elizabeth, Ind. "Delectable." Ends Dec. 31.

Indiana University Southeast Barr Gallery. 4201 Grant Line Road. "The Life of Brian: A 36 Year View," by Brian H. Jones. Ends Nov. 21.

Jane Morgan Gallery. 4838 Brownsboro Center. "Olmsted Parks Paintings II" and "Life Drawings of Charcoal, Pastel, Oil and Acrylic." Both end Friday.

Jeffersontown Historical Museum. 10635 Watterson Trail. Historic photos and artifacts. Ends Dec. 19.

Kaviar Forge & Gallery. 1718 Frankfort Ave. Opening Friday, "Abstract in Kentucky." Reception Friday, 6-9 p.m. Ends Jan. 3.

Kentucky Derby Museum. 704 Central Ave. "Horse Play," highlighting the playful side of the Kentucky Derby and featuring historical equine toys, digital interactives and music created for the museum. Ends Dec. 31. (502) 637-1111.

Kentucky Museum of Art & Craft. 715 W. Main St. "Ritual & Residue: The Art of Drink." Ends Nov. 9. (502) 589-0102.

Kentucky Science Center. 727 W. Main St. "The World We Create." Permanent exhibit that explores science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) through collaborative and open-ended challenges.

Kentucky Watercolor Society Gallery. 4836 Brownsboro Road. Opening Saturday, "Celebrating the Season in Watercolor." Ends Jan. 31.

Kore Gallery. Mellwood Art Center, 1860 Mellwood Ave. "Expressions in Imagination," by Mary Jane Allen. Ends Nov. 2.

Leslie H. Spetz Custom Picture Framing. 2400 Lime Kiln Lane, Suite C. Works by Jaime Corum, Lynn Dunbar, Robert Halliday and David Schuster. Ends Friday. (502) 426-8880.

Little Loomhouse. 328 Kenwood Hill Road. Saturday, 4-9 p.m., "Holiday in the Woods," art exhibit and sale. A fashion show with costumes depicting important figures in the Loomhouse's history will be on display 4-5 p.m.

Louisville Free Public Library. 301 York St. "Black Freedom, White Allies and Red Scare: Louisville, 1954." Ends Nov. 29.

Metro Hall. 527 W. Jefferson St. "Infinite Perspectives," by Ann Stewart Anderson, Ashley Brossart and Dhamin Jassim. Ends Jan. 16.

Paul Paletti Gallery. 713 E. Market St. "Small Worlds," photographs by Margaret Oechsli. Ends Dec. 29.

Peyton Samuel Head Family Museum. Oldham County History Center, 106 N. Second St., La Grange. "I Pledge Allegiance: Honoring Our World War II Veterans." Ends March 22, 2015.

Portland Museum. 2308 Portland Ave. Works by Julius Friedman. Ends Dec. 23.

Pyro Gallery. 909 E. Market St. "Collected Materials + Familiar Things," by Kim Huber. Ends Nov. 15.

Revelry Boutique Gallery. 742 E. Market. "Weird Like Me," by Dustin Dirt. Ends Nov. 6.

Roberta Marx Gallery. Thomas Jefferson Unitarian Church, 4936 Brownsboro Road. "Hand-Made Book Show." Ends Friday.

Swanson Contemporary. 638 E. Market St. "19+1 A Collaboration," by Joel Feldman, students of Common Good and Lexington Art League. Ends Nov. 15.

University of Louisville Hite Art Institute. Belknap Campus. "Deep Ecology," by Ying Kit Chan. Ends Saturday.

Vintage Fire Museum. 723 Spring St., Jeffersonville. "Harlan Hubbard: Plain Living, High Thinking - Part II." Ends Saturday.

Wayside Expressions Gallery. Wayside Christian Mission, 120 W. Broadway. "Three Women, One Show," painting and photography exhibit. Ends Nov. 4.

Other attractions

Lazer Blaze. 4121 Shelbyville Road, Friday, 4 p.m.-midnight; Saturday, 10 a.m.-midnight; Sunday, noon-9 p.m.; Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, 4-9 p.m. Laser tag, laser tag museum, arcade, cafe. $7 per game, $12 for two games. (502) 895-2985.

Robben's Roost. 5906 Six Mile Lane, Friday, 7-11 p.m.; Saturday, 1-4 and 7:30-10:30 p.m.; Sunday, 1-4 p.m.; Tuesday and Thursday, 11 a.m.-1 p.m. Roller skating. Fridays, $6; Saturday afternoons, $4, evenings, $5; Sundays, $4; Tuesdays and Thursdays, $3. (502) 491-8170.

Skate World. 6310 Preston Highway, 7-11 p.m. Fridays; 1-4 and 7-11 p.m. Saturdays; 1-4 p.m. Sundays, Tuesdays and Thursdays. Roller skating. Friday and Saturday evenings, $5; Saturday and Sunday afternoons, $4; Tuesdays and Thursdays, $3. (502) 969-6000.

Wheel Fun Rentals. Waterfront Park. 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. Bike rentals: cruisers, tandems, choppers, quad sports, deuce coupes, four-wheel surrey bikes. Group rates available. www.wheelfunrentals.com.

Open Range Sports. 6401 Cross Keys Blvd., Crestwood, 4-8 p.m. Friday; 11 a.m.-8 p.m. Saturday; noon-5 p.m. Sunday. Indoor paintball/reball and a gun range. (502) 243-8282; www.openrangesports.com.
